intro: Uragoga erioloba, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, velvety flowers. The plant typically features broad, waxy leaves and produces clusters of tubular or bell-shaped blooms in shades of purple, pink, and white. Uragoga erioloba thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. It is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
